title: Man City vs PSG live stream: how to watch Champions League from anywhere today
author: kevin-lynch
summary: Pep Guardiola’s side face off against Neymar, Messi and Mbappe
article: Tonight’s glamour tie at the Etihad sees Pep Guardiola’s men needing a point against the star-packed Parisians to secure their place in the Champions League knockout stage. Follow our guide as we explain how to watch an Man City v PSG live stream and catch all the action from the UCL, no matter where you are in the world today.
City will be looking to make amends for the 2-0 defeat to PSG at the Parc des Princes back in September, in a match that saw Idrissa Gueye and Lionel Messi on target for the French side.

The stakes are high, with Mauricio Pochettino's side just one point behind City and a win for PSG would see them leapfrog the Sky Blues into top spot and claim their place in the next round. Such a result which would leave City needing an away win against RB Leipzig at the beginning of December in order to be in the hat for the knock-out stages.
The match could finally see Sergio Ramos make his bow for PSG, with the former Real Madrid star named in the Ligue 1 side’s matchday squad for the first time since joining the club in the summer.

City will once again be without Kevin De Bruyne following his positive coronavirus test, while Jack Grealish will meanwhile face a late fitness test after missing his side’s win over Everton at the weekend with what was described as a minor injury.
Here's how to watch a Champions League Man City vs PSG live stream today from anywhere in the world.
